8004701 Basic metabolic panel (Calcium, ionized) This panel must include the    
8004702 following: Calcium, ionized (82330), Carbon dioxide (82374), Chloride   
8004703 (82435), Creatinine (82565), Glucose (82947), Potassium (84132), Sodium 
8004704 (84295), Urea Nitrogen (BUN) (84520)                                    
8004801 Basic metabolic panel (Calcium, total) This panel must include the      
8004802 following: Calcium, total (82310), Carbon dioxide (82374), Chloride     
8004803 (82435), Creatinine (82565), Glucose (82947), Potassium (84132), Sodium 
8004804 (84295), Urea nitrogen (BUN) (84520)                                    
8005001 General health panel This panel must include the following:             
8005002 Comprehensive metabolic panel (80053), Blood count, complete (CBC),     
8005003 automated and automated differential WBC count (85025 or 85027 and      
8005004 85004), OR, Blood count, complete (CBC), automated (85027) and          
8005005 appropriate manual differential WBC count (85007 or 85009), Thyroid     
8005006 stimulating hormone (TSH) (84443)                                       
8005101 Electrolyte panel This panel must include the following: Carbon dioxide 
8005102 (82374), Chloride (82435), Potassium (84132), Sodium (84295)            
8005301 Comprehensive metabolic panel This panel must include the following:    
8005302 Albumin (82040), Bilirubin, total (82247), Calcium, total (82310),      
8005303 Carbon dioxide (bicarbonate) (82374), Chloride (82435), Creatinine      
8005304 (82565), Glucose (82947), Phosphatase, alkaline (84075), Potassium      
8005305 (84132), Protein, total (84155), Sodium (84295), Transferase, alanine   
8005306 amino (ALT) (SGPT) (84460), Transferase, aspartate amino (AST) (SGOT)   
8005307 (84450), Urea nitrogen (BUN) (84520)                                    
8005501 Obstetric panel This panel must include the following: Blood count,     
8005502 complete (CBC), automated and automated differential WBC count (85025 or
8005503 85027 and 85004), OR, Blood count, complete (CBC), automated (85027) and
8005504 appropriate manual differential WBC count (85007 or 85009), Hepatitis B 
8005505 surface antigen (HBsAg) (87340), Antibody, rubella (86762), Syphilis    
8005506 test, non-treponemal antibody; qualitative (eg, VDRL, RPR, ART) (86592),
8005507 Antibody screen, RBC, each serum technique (86850), Blood typing, ABO   
8005508 (86900) AND, Blood typing, Rh (D) (86901)                               
8006101 Lipid panel This panel must include the following: Cholesterol, serum,

9920101 Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of a 
9920102 new patient, which requires these 3 key components: A problem focused   
9920103 history; A problem focused examination; Straightforward medical decision
9920104 making. Counseling and/or coordination of care with other providers or  
9920105 agencies are provided consistent with the nature of the problem(s) and  
9920106 the patient's and/or family's needs. Usually, the presenting problem(s) 
9920107 are self limited or minor. Physicians typically spend 10 minutes        
9920108 face-to-face with the patient and/or family.                            
9920201 Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of a 
9920202 new patient, which requires these 3 key components: An expanded problem 
9920203 focused history; An expanded problem focused examination;               
9920204 Straightforward medical decision making. Counseling and/or coordination 
9920205 of care with other providers or agencies are provided consistent with   
9920206 the nature of the problem(s) and the patient's and/or family's needs.   
9920207 Usually, the presenting problem(s) are of low to moderate severity.     
9920208 Physicians typically spend 20 minutes face-to-face with the patient     
9920209 and/or family.

9920302 new patient, which requires these 3 key components: A detailed history;

9920305 are provided consistent with the nature of the problem(s) and the       
9920306 patient's and/or family's needs. Usually, the presenting problem(s) are 
9920307 of moderate severity. Physicians typically spend 30 minutes face-to-face

9925202 these 3 key components: An expanded problem focused history; An expanded
9925203 problem focused examination; and Straightforward medical decision       
9925204 making. Counseling and/or coordination of care with other providers or  
9925205 agencies are provided consistent with the nature of the problem(s) and  
9925206 the patient's and/or family's needs. Usually, the presenting problem(s) 
9925207 are of low severity. Physicians typically spend 40 minutes at the       
9925208 bedside and on the patient's hospital floor or unit.                    
9925301 Inpatient consultation for a new or established patient, which requires 
9925302 these 3 key components: A detailed history; A detailed examination; and 
9925303 Medical decision making of low complexity. Counseling and/or            
9925304 coordination of care with other providers or agencies are provided      
9925305 consistent with the nature of the problem(s) and the patient's and/or   
9925306 family's needs. Usually, the presenting problem(s) are of moderate      
9925307 severity. Physicians typically spend 55 minutes at the bedside and on   
9925308 the patient's hospital floor or unit.

9925402 these 3 key components: A comprehensive history; A comprehensive        
9925403 examination; and Medical decision making of moderate complexity.        
9925404 Counseling and/or coordination of care with other providers or agencies 
9925405 are provided consistent with the nature of the problem(s) and the       
9925406 patient's and/or family's needs. Usually, the presenting problem(s) are 
9925407 of moderate to high severity. Physicians typically spend 80 minutes at

9928402 patient, which requires these 3 key components: A detailed history; A

9928405 or agencies are provided consistent with the nature of the problem(s)   
9928406 and the patient's and/or family's needs. Usually, the presenting        
9928407 problem(s) are of high severity, and require urgent evaluation by the

9930707 family's needs. Usually, the patient is stable, recovering, or          
9930708 improving. Physicians typically spend 10 minutes at the bedside and on

9930807 patient's and/or family's needs. Usually, the patient is responding     
9930808 inadequately to therapy or has developed a minor complication.
